Introduction.content:
In the dry land of Dodoma there was a small village called Jua Kali.

Every morning the sun rose right above their roofs like a big golden coin.

Children played in its light. Goats danced in its warmth.

One Tuesday, the sun did not rise.

It simply slipped lower and lowerâ€¦ until it fell straight into the village well with a loud PLOPP! ğŸ’¦

The sky turned purple. The air became cold. Everyone ran outside shouting.

Chapter 1.content:
The village elders brought torches and looked into the old stone well.

There, at the bottom, sat the sun.

It looked small and sad, like a lost orange ball.

An old woman asked, â€œSun, why did you fall?â€

The sun answered in a tiny voice:

â€œYou never say thank you anymore. I got tired of shining for free.â€

![Tiny sun sitting inside dark well](https://picsum.photos/seed/sun-inside-well/800/600)

Chapter 2.content:
Without the sun the village became ice.

Water turned hard. Breath became smoke.

Goats wore blankets. Chickens refused to lay eggs.

Children cried because their fingers hurt.

The chief promised, â€œWe will bring the sun back!â€

![Village wrapped in blankets under purple sky](https://picsum.photos/seed/cold-village-blankets/800/600)

Chapter 4.content:
Neema was only eight years old, but she was not scared.

She tied a rope around her waist and asked the strongest men to lower her down.

Down, down, down she went until her feet touched warm light.

She sat beside the sun and said,

â€œWe are sorry. We forgot to say thank you. Please come home.â€

![Little girl sitting next to tiny sun in well](https://picsum.photos/seed/neema-sun-well/800/600)

The whole village cheered and clapped.

![Sun flying back to sky with smiling village](https://picsum.photos/seed/sun-return-sky/800/600)

Conclusion.content:
From that day, every single morning in Jua Kali village, young and old stand outside and shout together:

â€œAsante sana, Jua!â€ (Thank you very much, Sun!)

And the sun shines brighter than ever, happy to be loved.

Even the goats bleat â€œAsante!â€ now.

The end.
